author: sfgate.com
title: Daily Briefing, Oct. 22
text:
Number of the day 
$19 billion 
That’s the approximate sale price of Milpitas flash-memory manufacturer SanDisk Corp. , which hard-drive maker Western Digital Corp. plans to buy. The company’s headquarters will be in Irvine, with Western Digital CEO Steve Milligan as its leader. Meanwhile, Fremont’s Lam Research Corp. is buying Milpitas’ KLA-Tencor Corp. for about $10.6 billion, creating a huge semiconductor company that will rival Applied Materials Inc. Page C3 
Hashtag this 
#MythYouGuys 
Wednesday was the day when all the explosions died in sorrow: Discovery announced that it is dropping the TV show “Mythbusters” after its next season, which begins in January, and the hashtag lets fans commiserate. The Chronicle profiled the show after it premiered in 2003, and Bay Area places have featured prominently in the experiments. In a subsequent story, co-host Adam Savage even showed off a secret lair in the Mission District .
Pizza 2.0 
Forget about building a better pizza: Domino’s has built a better pizza delivery car . Engadget reports that the pizza company now has tricked out some Chevy Sparks into DXPs (Delivery ExPerts), which have their own ovens and space for 80 pizzas. The DXP site lets you know which stores have the vehicles at any particular time (they shift around). As of Wednesday, there was one in San Francisco, but the company is adding more around the country.
The Daily Briefing is compiled from San Francisco Chronicle staff and news services. See more items and links at www.sfgate.com . Twitter: @techchronicle
